name: Dessert Vinaigrette For Figs
description: Vinaigrettes lend lightness and sparkle to food, but they generally land before the dessert course. But here, a warm orange vinaigrette livens up figs for a light and delicious dessert. This easy recipe, which was inspired by one from Michael Moorhouse, the pastry chef at Blue Hill at Stone Barns, comes together quickly.
keywords: champagne vinegar, figs, orange juice, dessert

recipeInstructions.text: Warm orange juice in a small saucepan. Add vinegar and sugar, and cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves. (Do not boil.) Whisk in oil and then butter until dressing emulsifies.
Wash fresh figs, and remove stems. Slice figs, and arrange in decorative pattern on a plate. Pour warm dressing on top; serve.
